comments: A number n is k-persistent iff all of {n, 2n,..., kn} are pandigital (in the sense of A171102).
links: Hans Havermann, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Persistent Number
prog: (PARI) is_A051020(n)=for(i=1, 5, 9<#Set(Vec(Str(i*n))) | return(i>4))  \\ - M. F. Hasler, Jan 10 2012
crossrefs: Cf. A171102 (pandigital), A204047 (smallest n-persistent), A051264 (1-persistent), A051018 (2-persistent), A051019 (3-persistent), A204096 (5-persistent), A204097 (6-persistent).
author: _Eric W. Weisstein_
extensions: Definition corrected by Franklin T. Adams-Watters, Jan 09 2012
